meanings.definition: To send (a letter or package) again by mail.
meanings.sent1: She remailed the lost package to ensure it reached its destination.
meanings.sent2: I had to remail the letter because I forgot to include the stamp.
meanings.sent3: The post office worker accidentally remailed the same package to himself.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness remailed in my heart long after the package arrived.
meanings.sent5: The act of remailing the letter showed her thoughtfulness and care.

meanings.sent1: He remailed the important email to make sure it was received.
meanings.sent2: I had to remail the document attachment as it didn't go through the first time.
meanings.sent3: The professor accidentally remailed the same email with the wrong attachment.
meanings.sent4: The urgency of the situation required him to remail the message immediately.
meanings.sent5: The decision to remail the email saved the project from delays.
